e4: Despite short-term market fluctuations, transitioning to an unbiased reporting policy is crucial for long-term ethical standing. While investors may need time to adjust, ultimately it fosters trust and transparency. Continued biased reporting carries the risk of legal repercussions and erodes the company's reputation.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes truthfulness and transparency. It presents financial information accurately, without manipulation or bias,  allowing stakeholders to make informed decisions. While legal compliance is essential, ethics go beyond the letter of the law by fostering trust and accountability. Considerate communication with investors about any changes is also crucial for building long-term confidence.
e6: Yes, I would ask about their plans to communicate the policy change to investors and address potential concerns.  I'd also inquire about their strategy for ensuring accurate reporting under the new policy and mitigating any risks associated with this transition.
